entry.title: LeetCode 696
entry.content:
Question

  • Give a string s, count the number of non-empty (contiguous) substrings that have the same number of 0â€™s and 1â€™s, and all the 0â€™s and all the 1â€™s in these substrings are grouped consecutively.

  • example

    Input: "00110011"Output: 6Input: "10101"Output: 4

Answer

const countBinarySubstrings = (s: string): number => {    let result: number = 0;    let pre: number = 0;    let cur: number = 1;    for (let i = 0, len = s.length - 1; i < len; i++) {        s[i] === s[i + 1] ? (cur += 1) : ((pre = cur), (cur = 1));        if (pre >= cur) {            result += 1;        }    }    return result;};

Result

æ€è·¯

  1. preæ˜¯ä¸Šä¸€ä¸ªæ•°å­—å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°
  2. curæ˜¯å½“å‰æ•°å­—å‡ºç°çš„æ¬¡æ•°
  3. ç”¨äº†ç©·ä¸¾æ³•ï¼Ÿï¼ŒæŠŠæ¯ä¸€ä½æ•°ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶çš„æ¬¡æ•°ç›¸åŠ ï¼Œè¿”å›result

ä¸¾ä¸ªğŸŒ° "00110"

  2. ç¬¬1ä½ 0 pre = 0, cur = 2, result = 0
  3. ç¬¬2ä½ 1 pre = 2, cur = 1, result = 1
  4. ç¬¬3ä½ 1 pre = 2, cur = 2, result = 2
